intro: Fagelia viscosissima, commonly known as the sticky fagelia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is notable for its sticky resin, which exudes from its stems and leaves, giving it its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
